snippet.title: The antibiotics that could kill you
snippet.description:
* In 2010, Americans were prescribed 258 million courses of antibiotics, a rate of 833 per thousand people. Such massive usage, billions of doses, has been going on year after year.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/22/opinion/blaser-antibiotic-winter/index.html

snippet.title: Report: USDA should do more to fight salmonella
snippet.description:
* Salmonellosis is a nasty illness. People infected with Salmonella develop diarrhea, a fever and abdominal cramps that usually last for four to seven days.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/12/19/health/salmonella-chicken-pew-report/index.html

snippet.title: Sick of salmonella? So is the USDA
snippet.description:
* Salmonella causes an estimated 1.3 million illnesses each year in the United States. The U.S. Department of Agriculture’s Food Safety...
http://eatocracy.cnn.com/2013/12/04/salmonella-action-plan/

snippet.title: How the shutdown could make you sick
snippet.description:
* This week, a mother called us about her child hospitalized with a Salmonella poisoning from his day care's chicken lunch. The child's condition was tenuous, with a blood infection, and treatment was especially challenging as the bacteria was antibiotic resistant.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/10/11/opinion/smith-dewaal-food-safety/index.html

http://eatocracy.cnn.com/2013/10/09/usda-demands-action-in-salmonella-outbreak/

snippet.title: Brote de salmonella que alarma a EE.UU. podría estar asociado a pollo contaminado
snippet.description:
* (CNN) – Un productor de carne de aves anunció el lunes que trabaja con funcionarios federales de salud luego de haberse reportado 278 enfermos en 18 estados. Los productos a base de pollo crudo provenientes de las plantas de Foster Farms han sido...
http://cnnespanol.cnn.com/2013/10/08/brote-de-salmonela-que-alarma-a-ee-uu-podria-estar-asociado-a-pollo-contaminado/
